instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: All other keys but the shift keys work, I replaced the keyboard but they still do not work, computer was liquid damaged

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message:
Does both the left and right shift not work?

Anyways inspect keyboard connector for corrosion and check continuity for all <SIGNAL>WS_KBD</SIGNAL> signals to the <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> chip
Already tried booting into a OS from USB to verify its not a software issue? (Pro tip: In ASD OS there is a keyboard test)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: yes its both shift keys, also ive never used asd before so no idea which version to use

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message:
My bad, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is the macbook pro 13" late 2013 right? Apple uses ASD2 for that which is not available for unauthorized stores :(

So like I said check the connector and <SIGNAL>WS_KBD</SIGNAL> signals. If thats all looking alright boot into something like Internet Recovery and see if you can use the shift key in there. Otherwise <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> might be damaged but this pretty much never happens

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: also forgot to mention that I had the customer try to do an smc reset just to see if it would work outside the os. and it didnt work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: Left shift and right shift are 2 completely different things. Right shift is part of the keyboard matrix along with all the other keys. Left shift is part of the SMC reset circuit. It seems unlikely both keys are not working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: customer claims both shift keys arent working, ive yet to get the computer back though, ill update when i get it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: okay so the customer finally brought the computer back, and it seems that both shift keys don't work along with the left option key, I had continuity between the connector and <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>. I tried another keyboard and that had the same results. Usb keyboard works fine. after using the usb keyboard the rest of the keys started misbehaving, not showing the correct character or doing nothing. so i replaced <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>. After the replacement absolutely nothing has changed, so i have no idea how to proceed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: Check if left SHIFT, OPTION and CONTROL are not functioning

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: i also had continuity to and from <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> for those keys, and replaced <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>, didnt solve the issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: That means no 3V42 to the keyboard on pin 4. Probably a bad connector but could be trace to the connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: i do get 3v42 to pin 4 on the connector

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: Pin 1 2 and 3 should come high when the corresponding key is pressed. Usually corroded pin inside the connector or bad keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: does the computer need to be on to run high or will it do it while off?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> shift keys dont work
threads.message: Can be off but needs to have 3V42 present so either battery or adapter needs connected.
